questions.question: Energy is a scalar quantity.
questions.explanation: Energy has magnitude only, no direction.

questions.question: Kinetic energy can be negative.
questions.explanation: KE = ½mv² is always positive since m and v² are positive.

questions.question: Potential energy depends on the reference point chosen.
questions.explanation: PE is measured relative to a chosen reference level.

questions.question: Energy can be created from nothing.
questions.explanation: Law of conservation: energy cannot be created or destroyed.

questions.question: Power is the rate of doing work.
questions.explanation: Power = Work/Time.

questions.question: Work and energy have the same unit.
questions.explanation: Both are measured in Joules.

questions.question: If velocity doubles, kinetic energy also doubles.
questions.explanation: KE ∝ v², so doubling v makes KE four times.

questions.question: Coal is a renewable source of energy.
questions.explanation: Coal is non-renewable; takes millions of years to form.

questions.question: Solar energy is renewable.
questions.explanation: Sun continuously provides energy.

questions.question: A body at rest has zero total energy.
questions.explanation: It has zero KE but can have PE due to position.

questions.question: In a pendulum, total mechanical energy remains constant.
questions.explanation: KE and PE interchange but total stays constant (ignoring friction).

questions.question: An electric motor converts electrical energy to mechanical energy.
questions.explanation: Motors produce rotational motion from electricity.

questions.question: Nuclear energy is released by chemical reactions.
questions.explanation: Nuclear energy is released by fission or fusion, not chemical reactions.

questions.question: Efficiency of a machine can be more than 100%.
questions.explanation: Due to losses, efficiency is always less than 100%.

questions.question: A flying bird has both kinetic and potential energy.
questions.explanation: KE due to motion, PE due to height.

questions.question: Wind energy is actually a form of solar energy.
questions.explanation: Wind is caused by uneven solar heating of Earth.

questions.question: The sun produces energy by nuclear fission.
questions.explanation: Sun produces energy by nuclear fusion.

questions.question: Work is done when a force causes displacement.
questions.explanation: W = F × d × cos θ.

questions.question: If you push a wall and it doesn't move, work done is zero.
questions.explanation: No displacement means zero work.
